channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. Transportation Department is urging air passengers to be on good behavior
item.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy wants air travelers to be nice this holiday season. A new DOT campaign asks passengers to help each other and thank flight attendants.
item.content:encoded:
Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy wants air travelers to be nice this holiday season. A new DOT campaign asks passengers to help each other and thank flight attendants.

(Image credit: Robert Alexander)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of JFK, says she has a rare terminal cancer
item.description: In an essay in The New Yorker, Tatiana Schlossberg says she has acute myeloid leukemia. She also criticized her relative, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
item.content:encoded:
In an essay in The New Yorker, Tatiana Schlossberg says she has acute myeloid leukemia. She also criticized her relative, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

(Image credit: Amber De Vos)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Texas men indicted in plot to take over Haitian island and enslave women and children
item.description: Gavin Weisenburg, 21, and Tanner Thomas, 20, planned to take over Gonave Island and murder all men on the island, prosecutors alleged.
item.content:encoded:
Gavin Weisenburg, 21, and Tanner Thomas, 20, planned to take over Gonave Island and murder all men on the island, prosecutors alleged.

(Image credit: Planet Observer/Universal Images Group)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: G20 summit closes in South Africa after U.S. absence
item.description: The G20 closed in Johannesburg without a ceremonial hand over to the U.S., its next chair, after Washington boycotted the summit.
item.content:encoded:
The G20 closed in Johannesburg without a ceremonial hand over to the U.S., its next chair, after Washington boycotted the summit.

(Image credit: Misper Apawu)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: 50 schoolchildren escape captivity in Nigeria, more than 200 still held
item.description: Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.
item.content:encoded:
Fifty of the 303 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic school in Nigeria's Niger state have escaped and are now with their families.

(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israel says it killed a senior Hezbollah official in first strike on Beirut in months
item.description: An Israeli airstrike has struck Beirut for the first time since June.
item.content:encoded:
An Israeli airstrike has struck Beirut for the first time since June.

(Image credit: Bilal Hussein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Women experience hair loss too. Here's what can help
item.description: Getting a diagnosis is key since there are different causes for the problem calling for different treatments. Here's what to know and how to find support if you are living with hair loss.
item.content:encoded: Getting a diagnosis is key since there are different causes for the problem calling for different treatments. Here's what to know and how to find support if you are living with hair loss.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: In DR Congo, exhibit reveals nostalgia for former dictator Mobutu
item.description: Nostalgia is rising in Congo for Mobutu Sese Seko — the kleptocratic strongman as a new museum exhibit glorifying him draws crowds in Kinshasa.
item.content:encoded:
Nostalgia is rising in Congo for Mobutu Sese Seko — the kleptocratic strongman as a new museum exhibit glorifying him draws crowds in Kinshasa.

(Image credit: Arsene Mpiana)
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: Here's why concerns about an AI bubble are bigger than ever
item.description: Tech companies are pouring billions into AI chips and data centers. Increasingly, they are relying on debt and risky tactics. Financial analysts are worried there's a bubble that will soon pop.
item.content:encoded:
Tech companies are pouring billions into AI chips and data centers. Increasingly, they are relying on debt and risky tactics. Financial analysts are worried there's a bubble that will soon pop.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: This civics competition lets high school students have their day in court
item.description: A month-long moot court program in New York City lets students prosecute — and defend — cases, offering real-world lessons in how government works.
item.content:encoded: A month-long moot court program in New York City lets students prosecute — and defend — cases, offering real-world lessons in how government works.
item.dc:creator: Sequoia Carrillo
